name: NPR
text:
Tuesday's surge of Black progressives could prove notable for the presidential race. 

If Democrats have two key pillars of their base fired up â€” women and Black voters â€” that could be a game-changer, as President Trumpâ€™s approval continues to suffer.

name: NPR
text:

name: NPR
text:
South Korea conscripted over 30,000 soldiers between the ages of 14 to 17 for the Korean War. An estimated 3,000 died.

Some believe these child soldiers saved the nation from defeat. 

The survivors are nearing 90. And they still want proper recognition. https://t.co/ZprJyr6wd0

name: NPR
text: Unrest over racial injustice spotlights the acute need for â€” and the high historical barriers to â€” mental health treatment for Black people. https://t.co/b2tauuJR0q

text:

text:
Many Black bookstore owners are busier than ever. Some tell NPR that they're grateful for the business, but heartbroken by the circumstances â€” and can't help but wonder how long the surge in interest will last.

name: NPR
text: For the sixth and final entry in @nprmusic's week-long series of letters by music writers in the LGBTQ+ community, Deborah Sprague writes about songs that reflect her experience as a trans woman. https://t.co/Q1KY0m4id1

text:

name: NPR
text: Under the governor's plan, nursing homes can only reopen if they have had no cases of the coronavirus for 14 consecutive days. Individual facilities have broad leeway to set their own restrictions. https://t.co/rCHCAqyslJ

name: NPR
text: One person was killed and another injured after shots were fired in a Louisville, Ky., park where demonstrators gathered to protest the police killing of Breonna Taylor. https://t.co/iS0Z78UrtX

name: NPR
text:
President Trump retweeted a video of a white man â€” driving a golf cart with "Trump 2020" and "America First" signs â€” yelling "white power" in response to protesters.

Sharing the video, Trump wrote, "Thank you to the great people of The Villages."
https://t.co/PWM9MSkEPi

name: NPR
text: Princeton University will remove Woodrow Wilson's name from its public policy school over "racist thinking and policies" the former U.S. president had championed, the university says. https://t.co/NWkF9OQI8w

name: NPR
text:
Update: President Trump has deleted the tweet.

The White House did not apologize for the tweet, saying instead: "President Trump is a big fan of The Villages. He did not hear the one statement made on the video." https://t.co/gg5g3TUAGI

name: NPR

name: NPR
text: While former Colorado Gov. John Hickenlooper is still seen as having an edge in his state's Senate primary, recent and past comments about race have dampened enthusiasm for him among some voters. https://t.co/QO3GPorBs1

name: NPR
text:
President Trump is denying a New York Times report that he was briefed on an alleged Russian effort to pay bounties to Taliban-linked militants to kill Western forces â€” including U.S. forces â€” in Afghanistan.

"Nobody briefed or told me," he tweeted.
